notes: Cooldown Reduction of multiple Octarine Cores does not stack.
Stacks multiplicatively with other sources of cooldown reduction.
abilities.description: Reduces the cooldown time of all spells and items by 25%.

additionalInformation: Does not stack with the cast range bonus of Aether Lens or other Octarine Cores.
name: Octarine Core
description: At the core of spellcraft are spectrums only the very gifted can sense.
trivia: Octarine Core's name is an homage to the comic fantasy book series Discworld, paying tribute to the writer Terry Pratchett who died about a month prior to the item's release. In the series, Octarine is a fictional color which is described as "resembling a flourescent greenish-yellow purple". The color can only be seen by wizards and by cats, which is also referenced by Octarine Core's item lore. Spell Lifesteal is also shown on a character with greenish-yellow and purple particle effects.

In the series, Octarine is a fictional color which is described as "resembling a flourescent greenish-yellow purple". The color can only be seen by wizards and by cats, which is also referenced by Octarine Core's item lore. Spell Lifesteal is also shown on a character with greenish-yellow and purple particle effects.
The components of Octarine Core before 7.27 are the same as the components of the pre-6.60 Aghanim's Scepter.
tips: If you have a hero with short cooldowns on your abilities, consider this item; casting your spells more often in a single fight is a major boon, and the increased casting range allows you to do so without having to stay in the middle of the fight for an extended duration.
